description.narrative: To improve economic governance by increasing revenue mobilisation, strengthening revenue administration and improving accountability of the Government to its citizens.

title.narrative: Customs processes and procedures harmonised with WTO Trade Facilitation Agreement and Revised Kyoto Convention (RKC)
Number of processes and procedures harmonised with World Trade Organisation (WTO) Trade Facilitation Agreement and Revised Kyoto Convention (RKC) by end of programme
One canine unit and 5 integrated border management (IBM) teams established
Number of canine units and border management teams established
1,000 GRA customs (and tax) staff trained in intelligence, investigation and risk management and Price Reference Database established
Number of GRA customs staff trained in intelligence, investigation and risk management and establishment of price reference database
150 special audits and 300 post clearance audits undertaken
Number of post clearance audits undertaken
Capacity of GRA Officers built to align with international best practices
Customs (GRA) Academy upgraded, number of foreign study tours undertaken and number of MPO M&E staff trained
Increase in revenue collected by customs
10% increase in amount of revenue collected by customs from 2014 to 2019
